title: Polar Change - limits of a function

content.question: ​Consider the graph of the polar function <math alttext="r equals f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math alttext="f open parentheses theta close parentheses equals fraction numerator 3 theta cubed plus 50 over denominator 2 theta to the power of 4 plus 5 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mi>θ</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>50</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>θ</mi><mn>4</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, in the polar coordinate system. Which of the following is true?

choices.label: ​​Because <math alttext="limit as theta rightwards arrow infinity of f open parentheses theta close parentheses equals negative infinity"><semantics><mrow><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, points on the graph of <math alttext="r equals f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> will be arbitrarily close to the origin for sufficiently large values of <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​Because <math alttext="limit as theta rightwards arrow infinity of f open parentheses theta close parentheses equals 0"><semantics><mrow><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, points on the graph of <math alttext="r equals f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> will be arbitrarily close to the origin for sufficiently large values of <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

Because <math alttext="limit as theta rightwards arrow infinity of f open parentheses theta close parentheses equals 3 over 2"><semantics><mrow><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, points on the graph of <math alttext="r equals f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> will be arbitrarily close to the polar curve <math alttext="r equals 3 over 2"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> for sufficiently large values of <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

Because <math alttext="limit as theta rightwards arrow infinity of f open parentheses theta close parentheses equals infinity"><semantics><mrow><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, points on the graph of <math alttext="r equals f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> will be increasingly distant from the origin for sufficiently large values of <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

content.answer: ​Because <math alttext="limit as theta rightwards arrow infinity of f open parentheses theta close parentheses equals 0"><semantics><mrow><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, points on the graph of <math alttext="r equals f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> will be arbitrarily close to the origin for sufficiently large values of <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.
